rComments: Scott Shaffer almost made me want to change my major because his ecology class BIOE 107 was so uninteresting. On every count he disappointed: failed to answer questions in class, even being proved wrong by students sometimes, unfair grading and ambiguous test questions made me thankful for my B+ even though I studied enough to get an A+. Avoid him!

Kind of boring, at least compared to Jenn Yost who taught the plant section. His slides lecture are really wordy. I ended up doing horrible on his final but thank goodness I got an A on the midterm. It could also be that I wasn't focused when I took the finals, but he's fair. He's clear, but don't offend him or else he gets defensive.

Okay..First of all he made attendance MANDATORY for our class. I received an A on every assignment, yet he gave me a B for missing a few classes. I am the kind of student that normally attends except he was so BORING!! His lecture style is horrible, he doesn't test you on what he teaches and his class royally sucked. Avoid him if you can.

Even though there is a lot of material on his powerpoint slides, just studying your notes won't get you by. You have to read the book too. He has learning objectives that are pretty helpful. If you know them back and forth, you should do well on his tests.

Ok, here's the deal with Shaffer: his lectures are pretty clear and simple, and he pretends like he'll only test you on the basic stuff.  but then when you get to the midterm... he tests you on the most stupid minute details ever!  i thought i was totally prepared for the midterm, but nope, i luckly got a C. luckly. study details and hormones!

He was apathetic, didn't seem to care much about the students. His test questions were confusing and unclear, so even if you complete understood everything...you could end up getting a C on the tests because didn't specify what he was asking for and just assumed all the students would know what he was saying.
I found this guy infuriating. He was very apathetic. He once told the students that he didn't know if he would answer e-mails before the final, because he doesn't get  paid for working weekends.

seriously. his lectures on animals were boring & s0o was he. to get even a passing grade, you'd have to attend lecture, read from the book & basically know your information BY HEART. his midterms tests you on the SMALLEST amount of information on EVERY aspect he teaches. oh yeah, his OH are offcampus s0o that'll be difficult to get to. bad class.

The midterm was very challenging and the class average on the test was a 67%.  Although I studied for hours out of the book and the notes, I still got average on the midterm. Perhaps he is better during the quarter, but I don't recommend taking him during the summer. The powerpoint presentations very were simplistic. Know applications! This is key.

Dr. Shaffer's not the best professor or lecturer, but he's more than decent. He teaches the animal half of 20b. His lectures cover what will be on the midterm, so be prepared to take notes for 1hr+ every lecture. He'll tell u what material to know from the book, and he kept to that promise. I liked the class, refreshing compared to 20A...

Obviously Bio20B won't be a walk in the park, but if you attend lecture EVERYDAY and refer to the book for clarification you'll do fine. But a word of caution, he has A LOT of notes so be prepared to write like crazy. Overall, its a passable class if you dedicate yourself to it. The only downside was his office hours are offcampus! =/

I got the sense he'd rather be out netting penguins or photographing albatross. I found this apathy toward much of the subject matter contagious, especially in contrast to the fresh-from-grad school enthusiasm of the other guy (Jim Jackson).
good teacher. he recycles his old midterm and final exams. just get them from someone who has taken his class.
He is fine, good guy though. No review or anything, just some general outlines and five sample questions.
damn.. i thougth bio 20B was supposed to be easier than A. i did not like this class. Dr. Shaffer is a nice guy to talk to, but his midterm was tricky and he doesnt curve.

Dr. Shaffer seems like a breeze.  Then you get to his midterm and you find that his lectures, which covered the basics, were deceptively simple. Study hard for his midterms and don't expect him to sympathize when you point out he made mistakes on the test
Excellent teacher...never boring, fair midterm, brings in cool examples. One of the best bio teachers out there.

in lectures, he makes it seem as though you only need to know the basics, but then on midterms tests you on little details that he said that you did not need to know. Also, he does not seem to know biology very well.

Extremely simplistic Power Point lectures.  His lectures are misleading though, his exams are tricky and cover material from the text (which he'll probably tell you he won't do).  If you can avoid him, do, he doesn't seem to know much about biology.
